Summary: Clear daylight. Sighting began as light hovering 35 degrees above horizon. Light deminished until a solid shape emerged. Object was pointed on each end like a discus viewed from the side.
divs: sighting detailsi am a truck driver driving a pickup and delivery route out of fort worth, texas. at approximately 15:40 on friday april 11, 2008 i had the following experience. i had just made a freight delivery and was pulling back onto fm 51 headed south\southwest approximately 8 miles south of granbury, texas. i noticed a light hovering off to my left approximately 35 degrees above the horizon and 30 degrees to my left (slightly east of due south from my location). my first thought was of the sun reflecting off of a conventional aircraft but as i continued to watch (casually at that point) i realized that the light was not moving and that the source of the light did not seem to be a reflection but rather was a glow emanating from that point. i then began to observe more closely. over the next two minutes (approximately) the light diminished in brightness until the well defined outline of an object could be clearly seem. it was elongated tapering in an arc from a center point to sharp points on either end. it was approximately 6 to 8 times as long as it was thick at the center point (approximately the shape of a track and field discus as viewed from the side). i was unable to observe any other dimensions so the exact configuration could not be determined. it could have been a disk shape viewed from the side or an elongated bullet shaped object. the object then began to recede directly away from me growing smaller but not changing shape or presenting any other view of it that would allow a better description. i had to look away for a few moments to negotiate a railroad crossing (i was still driving a truck) and when i looked back the object had completely vanished. by some dead reckoning based on the objects change in position relative to my truck and the distance traveled before the object began to move away i realized that the object had originally been hovering in the general vicinity of the comanche peak nuclear power plant. i would say within 2 to 3 miles of the facility and probably over the lake which resides on the north side of the plant. this estimate of the objects position gave me additional reason to believe that it was not a conventional aircraft in that i am reasonably certain that it was well within the no fly zone which it is my understanding exists around all nuclear power facilities. there was but one other item of interest to report. that is the fact that approximately 30 minutes after the sighting i realized that i had acquired a significant sunburn on all exposed portions of my body (face, head, neck and arms). while the sun was shining brightly that day i had not been exposed for any prolonged period; certainly no more so than on any typical day on my job and i rarely get sunburned on my job. also, i had not felt the sunburn coming on as i normally would. i simply had a sudden realization that i did in fact have a sunburn. i really did not at first associate this with the sighting but after both my wife and daughter commented on the unusual degree of sunburn i thought back on it and realized the timing of discovery of the sunburn. there were no other markings on my body to indicate any other type of contact with the object. also, there was no lost time as i was on a tight schedule that was not disrupted. this was not an abduction scenario. of some note perhaps is the fact that this incident occurred approximately 25 miles due east of the now famous town stephenville, texas.
